args:
Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" .
House speaker suggests Democratic votes could be needed on debt ceiling
Speaker Mike Johnson (R-Louisiana) hinted that the GOP-led Congress may have to rely on Democrats to raise the debt ceiling this year in an interview during the House GOP retreat in Doral, Florida.
Though Johnson and many Republicans would like to raise the debt ceiling with only Republican votes, the speaker blamed the Senate’s 60-vote threshold for making that goal difficult. “I think there’s some concern in the Senate that might be difficult to do on a partisan basis,” he said.
Senate Republicans hold 53 seats, meaning they need seven Democrats to agree on passing bills that require a filibuster-proof majority. Republicans are hoping to use and approve of a budgetary maneuver — often referenced as “reconciliation” — that would  lower the filibuster threshold to a simple majority to pass President Donald Trump’s agenda. Some House Republicans would like to tack the debt ceiling onto the reconciliation process — which is expected to address border security, energy and tax changes — because it could be passed with GOP-only votes. But it’s unclear whether the debt ceiling can be included under the strict budgetary parameters of reconciliation.
House Republicans privately say they will need Democratic help, too, given that many fiscal hawks have pledged not to support raising the debt ceiling unless there are substantial spending cuts.
